summary: if the Heavens ever did speak
title: if the Heavens ever did speak
body:
by lovingwriter

“But at the same time I thought maybe I would want to teach my kids what it says on the Bible. That, that if you’ll be nice you’ll be treated nicely. Or that you can always trust that there’s someone who listens. I don’t know, it’s, it’s a mess, I know”, he says next and Eliott reaches to pull Lucas against his chest.

“And then what you said just a few moments ago, about me and dad…”, Lucas doesn’t finish the sentence, instead he shivers. Eliott squeezes Lucas tightly.

or Lucas and Eliott early in the morning arguing and making up.

Words: 2277, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: SKAM (France)
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Eliott Demaury, Lucas Lallemant, mentions of lucas’ parents
  • Relationships: Eliott Demaury/Lucas Lallemant
  • Additional Tags: Angst, Angst with a Happy Ending, Emotional Hurt/Comfort, Christianity, talk about church, Future Fic, Established Relationship, Abandonment Issues, Implied/Referenced Child Abuse, Child Abandonment, Bipolar Disorder, Mental Health Issues, Arguing, Makeup, give Lucas Lallemant a hug, protect him at all costs, Heavy Angst, talking things through, papa lallemant is an asshole, Religion

none of the pics are mine
summary: Hi! Are you still doing your Elu headcanons? If so, how about no. 5 or/and no. 25? Thank you! :)
question: Hi! Are you still doing your Elu headcanons? If so, how about no. 5 or/and no. 25? Thank you! :)
answer:
ELU Headcanon #5: A cherished personal belonging.

Where is it? No, no, no! Fuck! Lucas’ head was reeling from trying to recall where it is.

Lucas knew he was in big trouble now. He had just one job, and that was to make sure to pack everything before they left for their trip to Morocco. The girls had been excited about some summer getaway trip to Morocco. And apparently, Yann and the boys were all going too. And so Lucas had no choice but to tag along. Especially when they told him, he could take his boyfriend, Eliott, and he immediately agreed as he realized the fantastic times he could have this summer with Eliott. Getting excited about the mere thought of the warm sunny beaches— laying there on the sand with Eliott as they would whisper soft romantic nonsense to each other and laugh until their lungs tighten from happiness as they immersed themselves in their bliss. And then eventually, the gang would gather around a massive bonfire with Lucas and Eliott being that couple that snuggles up together while feeding each other toasted s'mores. And when night finally falls, they would look up and stargaze and make-out with each other to their heart’s content.

But now, the dream was shattered when Lucas found out he had forgotten where he had put Eliott’s precious ring. No, no, not the skull one he’s always wearing but another one. A plain silver looking one. Why was it so special? What was unique about it was the fact that it had Lucas’ name engraved inside the ring’s inner wall. On the engravement reads, ’Minute par minute. Je t'aime, Lucas.’

When Eliott had surprised him on their first anniversary with it, Lucas could barely stop himself from crying, and it was such a precious gift. And now Lucas has lost it! Lucas was close to having a panic attack when he hears Eliott finally arrives back to their apartment. Eliott worked on the mornings and afternoons, which was why he couldn’t help finish packing today as it was his last day of work before he takes his mini vacation. Their flight leaves that night at 20:00, and it was currently 16:40. Lucas was so screwed!

“Hello? Lucas? Are you ready to go yet?” Came Eliott’s voice from the front door room. Lucas was silent as a mouse. He didn’t know what to do! His breathing was labored, and his body shook as he frantically tried to calm down but failed in the process as he slowly begins to spiral. How could I lose it? It’s such a precious gift, and now he’s probably missed it in the laundry mat they went together yesterday. Too busy kissing on the washing machines and goofing around to thoroughly check—Or it could be in the pockets of—ah fuck.

“—cas, Lucas? Hey, look at me! Are you okay?!” Lucas didn’t even realize he had stopped breathing until he looked up into those steel eyes that reflected him in their gaze. He lets out a sob that sounded so fragile even to his ears. Eliott immediately pulls him in for a tight embrace. After a few moments of rocking Lucas back and forth as he cooed him with soft, assuring words. Eliott loosened his hold and tried locking eyes with Lucas again. “Baby, what’s wrong? Please, you gotta tell me, yeah?” Eliott proceeds to lean his forehead against Lucas’, trying to soothe his trembling body and bring Lucas back to him.

Come back to me.

Lucas swallowed the lump in his throat and hesitantly stammered out, “I—I don’t know where it is, Eli! That ring of ours! I’ve lost it! I’m such a—I’m so sorry…” Lucas’ voice died when he bravely peers up to look at Eliott and found nothing but relief appearing on Eliott’s face and something else. Endearment? But why?

“Putain! Lucas, I thought you had a panic attack. Don’t scare me like that…” Eliott was trying to lighten up the mood but clears his throat when Lucas still had glassy eyes from crying earlier, looking lost. “Wait, you’re not mad? Wha—” Lucas was beyond confused. Eliott cuts in, “Lucas, listen…I know how much you loved that ring, but honestly, it’s fine. It’s okay. I’m sure we’ll find it.”

Elliott cradles Lucas’ face as he looked intensely into the younger boy’s ocean eyes. “The one I cherish most is right here.” Lucas was pretty sure he stopped breathing altogether, rendering him speechless. His heart rate accelerated. Elliott continued softly, “because no matter what happens, you’re the one thing I can’t lose.” Eliott gently caresses his cheeks by wiping away the tears and look into his eyes to make sure his words got to Lucas before bringing his lips upon Lucas’. Sealing it and soon, they were both devouring each other’s mouths. Swallowing the breath between them and the tongues that explored playfully eventually became hungry and consumed them both.

Lucas got so caught in the moment that he had almost forgotten what they were talking about as Eliott lifted him by his thighs and proceeded to carry him to the kitchen counter all while they were kissing. Lucas could barely stop himself from moaning as their hips met with such friction as Eliott throws his shirt over his head, making his hair wilder than ever. ’He can’t be real,’ thought Lucas. Eliott’s chest was heaving as he was just as out of breath as Lucas. ’And he’s all mine,’ Lucas thought possessively. But before he could do something about it, Lucas was the one first to break apart; his anxiety was still nagging him. Panting from Eliott sucking on his bottom lip, he brought his right hand on Eliott’s heart to indicate for him to stop. Eliott was quick to react and immediately halted his hands from playing with Lucas’ waistband and looked into Lucas’ eyes for signs of discomfort and rejection. “Are you okay? I still feel awful about—” Lucas murmured sadly but was shunned by Eliott’s finger on his lips. “Shhh, baby. It’s really fine.” Eliott reassures Lucas again by kissing him hard before breaking apart, leaving Lucas starstruck. “But if you want to stop, I suppose we can start getting read—” Lucas shuts Eliott up by pulling him back, and Eliott laughs into their kiss as he continues to pepper kisses on Lucas’ neck and down to his stomach, going lower and lower…

…

They were going to be okay. The trip was going to be amazing, even if they were probably going to be late. Besides, who said Eliott couldn’t get Lucas another ring. And maybe this time, it was to ask him a question. A very crucial question. But for now, Lucas and Eliott were content with their lives, to be there for each other, to be young and in love.

//

(Note: I’m so sorry for the late submission but I hope this can make up for it! ❤)

Lucas knew he was in big trouble now. He had just one job, and that was to make sure to pack everything before they left for their trip to Morocco. The girls had been excited about some summer getaway trip to Morocco. And apparently, Yann and the boys were all going too. And so Lucas had no choice but to tag along. Especially when they told him, he could take his boyfriend, Eliott, and he immediately agreed as he realized the fantastic times he could have this summer with Eliott. Getting excited about the mere thought of the warm sunny beaches— laying there on the sand with Eliott as they would whisper soft romantic nonsense to each other and laugh until their lungs tighten from happiness as they immersed themselves in their bliss. And then eventually, the gang would gather around a massive bonfire with Lucas and Eliott being that couple that snuggles up together while feeding each other toasted s'mores. And when night finally falls, they would look up and stargaze and make-out with each other to their heart’s content.

But now, the dream was shattered when Lucas found out he had forgotten where he had put Eliott’s precious ring. No, no, not the skull one he’s always wearing but another one. A plain silver looking one. Why was it so special? What was unique about it was the fact that it had Lucas’ name engraved inside the ring’s inner wall. On the engravement reads, ’Minute par minute. Je t'aime, Lucas.’

When Eliott had surprised him on their first anniversary with it, Lucas could barely stop himself from crying, and it was such a precious gift. And now Lucas has lost it! Lucas was close to having a panic attack when he hears Eliott finally arrives back to their apartment. Eliott worked on the mornings and afternoons, which was why he couldn’t help finish packing today as it was his last day of work before he takes his mini vacation. Their flight leaves that night at 20:00, and it was currently 16:40. Lucas was so screwed!

“Hello? Lucas? Are you ready to go yet?” Came Eliott’s voice from the front door room. Lucas was silent as a mouse. He didn’t know what to do! His breathing was labored, and his body shook as he frantically tried to calm down but failed in the process as he slowly begins to spiral. How could I lose it? It’s such a precious gift, and now he’s probably missed it in the laundry mat they went together yesterday. Too busy kissing on the washing machines and goofing around to thoroughly check—Or it could be in the pockets of—ah fuck.

“—cas, Lucas? Hey, look at me! Are you okay?!” Lucas didn’t even realize he had stopped breathing until he looked up into those steel eyes that reflected him in their gaze. He lets out a sob that sounded so fragile even to his ears. Eliott immediately pulls him in for a tight embrace. After a few moments of rocking Lucas back and forth as he cooed him with soft, assuring words. Eliott loosened his hold and tried locking eyes with Lucas again. “Baby, what’s wrong? Please, you gotta tell me, yeah?” Eliott proceeds to lean his forehead against Lucas’, trying to soothe his trembling body and bring Lucas back to him.

Come back to me.

Lucas swallowed the lump in his throat and hesitantly stammered out, “I—I don’t know where it is, Eli! That ring of ours! I’ve lost it! I’m such a—I’m so sorry…” Lucas’ voice died when he bravely peers up to look at Eliott and found nothing but relief appearing on Eliott’s face and something else. Endearment? But why?

“Putain! Lucas, I thought you had a panic attack. Don’t scare me like that…” Eliott was trying to lighten up the mood but clears his throat when Lucas still had glassy eyes from crying earlier, looking lost. “Wait, you’re not mad? Wha—” Lucas was beyond confused. Eliott cuts in, “Lucas, listen…I know how much you loved that ring, but honestly, it’s fine. It’s okay. I’m sure we’ll find it.”

Elliott cradles Lucas’ face as he looked intensely into the younger boy’s ocean eyes. “The one I cherish most is right here.” Lucas was pretty sure he stopped breathing altogether, rendering him speechless. His heart rate accelerated. Elliott continued softly, “because no matter what happens, you’re the one thing I can’t lose.” Eliott gently caresses his cheeks by wiping away the tears and look into his eyes to make sure his words got to Lucas before bringing his lips upon Lucas’. Sealing it and soon, they were both devouring each other’s mouths. Swallowing the breath between them and the tongues that explored playfully eventually became hungry and consumed them both.

Lucas got so caught in the moment that he had almost forgotten what they were talking about as Eliott lifted him by his thighs and proceeded to carry him to the kitchen counter all while they were kissing. Lucas could barely stop himself from moaning as their hips met with such friction as Eliott throws his shirt over his head, making his hair wilder than ever. ’He can’t be real,’ thought Lucas. Eliott’s chest was heaving as he was just as out of breath as Lucas. ’And he’s all mine,’ Lucas thought possessively. But before he could do something about it, Lucas was the one first to break apart; his anxiety was still nagging him. Panting from Eliott sucking on his bottom lip, he brought his right hand on Eliott’s heart to indicate for him to stop. Eliott was quick to react and immediately halted his hands from playing with Lucas’ waistband and looked into Lucas’ eyes for signs of discomfort and rejection. “Are you okay? I still feel awful about—” Lucas murmured sadly but was shunned by Eliott’s finger on his lips. “Shhh, baby. It’s really fine.” Eliott reassures Lucas again by kissing him hard before breaking apart, leaving Lucas starstruck. “But if you want to stop, I suppose we can start getting read—” Lucas shuts Eliott up by pulling him back, and Eliott laughs into their kiss as he continues to pepper kisses on Lucas’ neck and down to his stomach, going lower and lower…

…

They were going to be okay. The trip was going to be amazing, even if they were probably going to be late. Besides, who said Eliott couldn’t get Lucas another ring. And maybe this time, it was to ask him a question. A very crucial question. But for now, Lucas and Eliott were content with their lives, to be there for each other, to be young and in love.

//

(Note: I’m so sorry for the late submission but I hope this can make up for it! ❤)

Panting from Eliott sucking on his bottom lip, he brought his right hand on Eliott’s heart to indicate for him to stop. Eliott was quick to react and immediately halted his hands from playing with Lucas’ waistband and looked into Lucas’ eyes for signs of discomfort and rejection. “Are you okay? I still feel awful about—” Lucas murmured sadly but was shunned by Eliott’s finger on his lips. “Shhh, baby.
